Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sneaker \Sneak"er\ (sn[=e]k"[~e]r), n. 1. One who sneaks. --Lamb. [1913 Webster]
2. A vessel of drink. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]
A sneaker of five gallons. --Spectator. [1913 Webster]
3. A type of soft shoe with a flat, pliable, typically rubber or other soft sole, and canvas-like upper, used in sports such as tennis, or for comfort. Called sneaker because they give no warning of one's approach. Usually used in the pl. [Webster 1913 Suppl. +PJC]
4. A punch bowl. [Obs.] --Spectator. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
sneaker n. An individual hired to break into places in order to test their security; analogous to {tiger team}. Compare {samurai}.

sneaker n 1: a canvas shoe with a pliable rubber sole [syn: {gym shoe}, {tennis shoe}] 2: someone acting as an informer or decoy for the police [syn: {fink}, {snitch}, {snitcher}, {stoolpigeon}, {stoolie}, {sneak}, {canary}]
